Model state¶

tasmania.utils.data_utils.get_state(raw_state, grid, units)¶
Parameters:
  • raw_state (dict) –
  • whose keys are strings indicating the variables (Dictionary) –

:param included in the model state, and values are numpy.ndarrays: :param containing the data for those variables.: :param grid: The underlying computational grid. :type grid: grid :param units: :type units: dict :param Dictionary whose keys are strings indicating the variables: :param included in the model state, and values are strings indicating: :param the units in which those variables should be expressed.:

Returns:
  • dict
  • Dictionary whose keys are strings indicating the variables
  • included in the model state, and values are sympl.DataArrays
  • containing the data for those variables.

Parameters:
  • state (dict) –
  • whose keys are strings indicating the variables (Dictionary) –

:param included in the model state, and values are sympl.DataArrays: :param containing the data for those variables.: :param units: :type units: dict, optional :param Dictionary whose keys are strings indicating the variables: :param included in the model state, and values are strings indicating: :param the units in which those variables should be expressed.:

  • included in the model state, and values are numpy.ndarrays
  • containing the data for those variables.
tasmania.utils.data_utils.add(state_1, state_2, units=None)¶

Sum up two model states.

state_1 : dict Dictionary whose keys are strings indicating the variables included in the first model state, and values are sympl.DataArrays containing the data for those variables. state_2 : dict Dictionary whose keys are strings indicating the variables included in the second model state, and values are sympl.DataArrays containing the data for those variables. units : dict, optional Dictionary whose keys are strings indicating the variables included in the model state, and values are strings indicating the units in which those variables should be expressed. If not specified, a variable is included in the output state in the same units used in the first state, or the second state if the variable is not present in the first state.

dict : Dictionary whose keys are strings indicating the variables included in either the first or second model state, and values are sympl.DataArrays containing the data for those variables. If a variable is present in both states, the corresponding values are summed up.

Raises:TimeInconsistencyError : – If the two passed states are defined at two different time instants.
